alert.note: Alert for Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Brevard and east central Osceola Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 521 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Camp Holly Fish Camp, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Rockledge, Cocoa Beach and Satellite Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands
